title: Braised Short Ribs With Mascarpone Polenta
summary: Braised Short Ribs With Mascarpone Polenta might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 740 calories, 30g of protein, and 63g of fat. This recipe serves 21. For $3.8 per serving, this recipe covers 28% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 6 minutes. Head to the store and pick up mushrooms, chicken broth, onions, and a few other things to make it today. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 83%. This score is outstanding. Try Cabernet-Braised Short Ribs with Gorgonzola Polentan and Mixed-Herb Gremolata, Braised Not-So-Short Short Ribs with Hominy Stew from A New Turn in the South, and Cabernet Short Ribs with Parmesan Polenta for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Beef Short Ribs. Beef and red wine are a classic combination. Generally, leaner cuts of beef go well with light or medium-bodied reds, such as pinot noir or merlot, while fattier cuts can handle a bold red, such as cabernet sauvingnon. One wine you could try is Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 40 dollars.

productMatches.title: Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot
productMatches.description: Bright red fruits, candied blueberry, Santa Rosa plum and menthol aromas all blend together to intoxicate the nose as the 2016 Harris Vineyard Merlot wafts from the glass. On the palate, a juicy and fruity entry is supported by chewy tannins and a balancing acidity, creating lush layers that coat the tongue and produce a soft, elegant finish.
